intro: Gigasiphon macrosiphon, commonly known as the giant siphon, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter, typically displaying vibrant yellow or orange hues. The plant features robust, woody stems that can grow several meters in height, making it a prominent feature in its native habitat. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Native to tropical regions, Gigasiphon macrosiphon thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland environments.
